title: Scrollbars should be disabled in ImageAnalyzer example
description: The scrollbars in the ImageAnalyzer example are enabled, but they don't have any effect.
OB: When opening the ImageAnalyzer example in Build F2 (20020602) on Redhat 7.2 with GTK2KDE 2.210 (GTK2 only), the scrollbars are enabled and can be moved around. However, they don't have any effect on the image displayed. Even when opening a small image like an icon, the scrollbars are misleading because they don't do anything.
EB: The scrollbars in the ImageAnalyzer example should be disabled when they have no effect on the image. This will prevent confusion for users trying to interact with the scrollbars.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Build F2 (20020602) on Redhat 7.2 with GTK2KDE 2.210 (GTK2 only).
2. Open the ImageAnalyzer example.
3. Notice that the scrollbars are enabled and can be moved around.
4. Attempt to scroll the image using the scrollbars and observe that they have no effect.
5. Open a small image like an icon and notice that the scrollbars are misleading because they don't do anything.
